intro: Androsace × dentata, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a hybrid plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features hairy, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Androsace × dentata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
